title: 109_hr2295
content:
The "Parental Empowerment Act of 2005" may be cited as the short title. It includes required policies and procedures. The "Parental Empowerment Act of 2005" mandates that States implement policies requiring the maintenance of parent review and empowerment councils for the purchase of educational materials in elementary schools. Each council must have 5-15 members, with a majority having a child enrolled in an elementary school operated by the educational agency. At least one member must have a child in the agency's kindergarten program. The council provides input on purchasing decisions for the agency. The council, consisting of 5-15 members with a majority having children in elementary school, provides recommendations to the educational agency on purchasing library or classroom materials for elementary schools. Recommendations include accepting, releasing part of, or rejecting proposed purchases. Each council, comprised of 5-15 members with a majority having elementary school children, recommends on purchasing library or classroom materials for elementary schools. Recommendations involve approving, releasing part of, or rejecting proposed purchases before the acquisition date. Meetings are held every 6 months for review and recommendations. SEC. 4. RULE OF CONSTRUCTION: This Act does not create a Federal prohibition against the purchase of library or classroom materials by State or local educational agencies if deemed appropriate. 

SEC. 5. REPORT: The Secretary will conduct a study and submit a report on the results achieved under this Act to relevant committees within 18 months of enactment.

SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, "applicable educational agency" refers to the local or State educational agency. "Child" refers to a child within the age limits for free public education. "Council" is a parent review and empowerment council. "Elementary school" includes kindergartens operated by the educational agency. The term "kindergarten" is part of the State's elementary education program. The term "library or classroom-based reference, instructional, or other print material" excludes school textbooks. The term "local educational agency" is defined in the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Education. The term "State" includes various territories and possessions of the United States. The term "State educational agency" is defined in the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965.
